title: Pele's son sentenced to 12 years in jail
text:
25 Feb 2017 - 3:05pm Pele's son sentenced to 12 years in jail Picture taken in 2007 of Brazilian football star Pele (right) and his son, former footballer and coach of goalkeepers in Santos FC, Edson Cholbi Nascimento. (AFP) Edson Cholbi do Nascimento, the son of Brazilian football legend Pele, has been sentenced to more than 12 years in prison for laundering drug money. Source: 
The 46-year-old retired footballer known as Edinho was originally convicted in 2014 of laundering money for a crime gang involved in drug trafficking and sentenced by a Brazilian court to 33 years in jail, then freed pending an appeal. 
Brazilian media says a judge has now reduced the sentence to 12 years and 10 months. 
Edinho, who denies the charges, was a goalkeeper in the 90s for several clubs, but never matched his father's career.
